intro: Eulophia borbonica, commonly known as the Bourbon Eulophia, is a member of the orchid family (Orchidaceae) native to Madagascar. It is a terrestrial orchid characterized by its tall, erect stem and showy, often fragrant flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically produces racemes of white or pale yellow flowers with intricate patterns on the petals and sepals. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. Eulophia borbonica is valued for its ornamental beauty and is often cultivated in botanical gardens and by orchid enthusiasts.
